text: <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibits nuclear factor-kappa B / Rel nuclear activity in CD3 - stimulated human peripheral T lymphocytes .
<extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> markedly reduces nuclear factor ( NF ) - kappa B / Rel nuclear activity induced in PBMC by stimulation with the anti-CD3 mAb OKT3 .
The inhibition is exerted specifically on the NF-kappa B / Rel activation induced by mAb OKT3 , and not that produced by PMA .

As judged by supershifting the DNA - protein complexes with Abs recognizing specific components of the NF-kappa B / Rel protein family , the <extra_id_0> p50 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> / <extra_id_0> p65 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ( <extra_id_0> Rel A <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> ) heterodimeric form of NF-kappa B is primarily affected .

text: The maximal effect is observed at the <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> concentration of 20 U / ml .
<extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> inhibitory activity is exerted on T lymphocytes and is mediated by monocytes .
Indeed , monocytes pretreated with <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> are able so inhibit NF-kappa B nuclear activity in purified T lymphocytes stimulated with OKT3 .
Soluble factors do not appear to be involved in the mechanism of inhibition .

On the other hand , the up-regulation of <extra_id_0> CD80 Ag <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , found on monocytes obtained from PBMC incubated with OKT3 , is not detected after addition of <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , and the anti - <extra_id_0> CD28 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> mAb CLB-CD28 / 1 restores the NF-kappa B / Rel nuclear activity in <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> - inhibited lymphocytes .

text: Therefore , the NF-kappa B / Rel inhibition might be ascribed to a lack of cooperation between accessory cells and T lymphocytes , resulting from down-regulation of a costimulatory molecule , such as <extra_id_0> CD80 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> , produced by <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> on activated monocytes .

text: Our results demonstrate that <extra_id_0> IL-10 <extra_id_2> Protein <extra_id_1> can inhibit the induction of NF-kappa B / Rel nuclear activity in CD3 - stimulated T lymphocytes .

Since inappropriate activation of kappa B - driven genes has a physiopathologic role in a number of diseases , such as HIV infection , our findings support the possibility of using this cytokine to suppress an undesirable activation of these transcription factors .
